Just wondering, who are some of your favorite villains? Here's some of mine.
 
 1) Darth Sidious (Self-explanitory)
 
 2) Dr. Tolian Soran (Star Trek: Generations)
 
 3) Marty Swayzak (Backdraft)

I never really cared for the villians. If I have to choose I would say the wicked witch of the west she was so darn campy to the point of being funny. Seriously I would be extremely upset too if someone dropped a house on my sister, killing her, then stealing her shoes. 
 Come to think of it. I do have one villian , whom I can identify with, Magneto from X-men. He wants equality and justice for mutants in a world full of prejudice, fear, and hatred towards mutants. (sound familiar)
 
 

 
 1) Darth Sidious (Self-explanitory)
 
 

 
 I would say this was true if we identify personally with the villian. I can see this just from reading your posts.

Emma Frost, a.k.a. White Queen. She has got to be the hottest villian ever created by the comic book industry, certainly in the X-Men series. She has the ability to use psychic powers like telekenisis and she can turn her skin into diamond. emoticon_xkill Emma Frost, however, does become a good guy in the later series of X-Men but she still retains those evil personality traits that make her what she is, awesome!
Hanibal Lector. Also the Inkeeper and his wife from Les Mis and the Engineer from Miss Saigon. Ohh and DRACULA

Q from Star Trek The Next Generation (and appeared in Deep Space 9 & Voyager) Okay fine, he's not really a villain. He started out as one, but then he became more of a nuisance to Picard.
 
 Biff from Back To The Future
 
 Dark Helmet Man from Spaceballs
 
 Riddler from Batman Forever
 
 There may be more added later.

[QUOTE=Ooaman]Riddler from Batman Forever
 QUOTE]
 
 Jim Carey!? I loved him in that movie. He played the perfect Riddler, insane but hilarious! emoticon_xkill That's got to be one of his creepiest roles ever.

Alderman Swayzak from the movie:"Backdraft" epitomizes pure unadulterated greed. He was willing to sacrifice firefighters' lives for money.
 
 BTW, here's some more of my faves:
 
 Count Baltar (Battlestar Galactica[1978 version])
 
 
 Dorian Tyrell (The Mask)

Voldemort from Harry Potter
 Delores Umbridge from Harry Potter as well
 
 There are some other great villains out there that I'm sure I'll think of later.
 
 Are we talking only movies here, or are books ok too?

Doesn't matter.

 Ok, figured as much. I'll keep thinking.

Sheriff of Nottingham in Robin Hood Prince of Thieves
 Alan Rickman is great in this role. He's quite funny actually "And no more merciful beheadings!"
 
 Alan Rickman is just fanatastic in general. He is also a great villain as Elliott Marston in Quigley Down Under
Venom from Spiderman. An awesome character for the comic industry. The only villain that can truly seem to defeat Spiderman due to the fact that Spiderman can't sense him.

Hmm....got quite a few favorites like Sephiroth who someone seems to have a pic of. emoticon_xgood 
 
 I'm guessing this can be any kind of villain from any fiction what so ever including video games? If so I'd have to identify mostly with is a certain white mage from L. E. Modesitt, Jr.'s The Magic of Recluse. (Its a book!) He's evil in how he justifies everything he does for a greater good because his sect is now gone and at the same time gathers power around himself. Can't really remember his name...I think it was Antonidas or something. emoticon_confused Any how his ultimate goal is gaining as much knowledge through any means neccesary and brings truth to the quote, "Knowledge is power" However, his downfall also kinda says that too much knowledge gained at the cost of others can destroy you. Pick up the book its a pretty good read. :) 
 
 All the other villains I like for other various reasons, I've never found the good guys that great in everything I've watched, read, or played. (There have been some exceptions though) Even when I was younger and watched G.I. Joe I remember wondering "Why doesn't Cobra ever win?" emoticon_xgood

I'm guessing this can be any kind of villain from any fiction what so ever including video games?

 What video game villains would you include?
 
All the other villains I like for other various reasons, I've never found the good guys that great in everything I've watched, read, or played. (There have been some exceptions though)

 What would be those exceptions?

What video game villains would you include?
 
 What would be those exceptions?

 
 Well, Sephiroth(Final Fantasy VII), Deathwing (Warcraft), and Albert Whesker (Resident Evil).
 
 Some exceptions would be Captain Jack Sparrow (Pirates of the Carribean)...although I did enjoy the bad guy in that movie too :D, Haplo from the Deathgate Cycle, and a few other that I just can't remember right now. :P
Dracula in Bram Stoker's Dracula (1992) by Francis Ford Coppola
If video games are included, I would add Bowser to my list (from the Mario Bros. games.) Except for the fact that I think he changed his name somewhere between the NES and Super NES.

Wow... Dracula, Sephiroth, and Bowser were going to be my three, but those have already been taken. What are the chances of that. Now I'll have to rethink it. :xbanghead

Wow... Dracula, Sephiroth, and Bowser were going to be my three, but those have already been taken. What are the chances of that. Now I'll have to rethink it. :xbanghead

 Kefka the insane clown! I didn't quite like him as much as Sephiroth from FF7, but he's definitely the second best from the series. emoticon_xgood 
 
 Scorpion (Get over here!) and Venom are great too...I wonder how much my old Venom comics might be worth now. $$$
 
 Also got another favorite and if you all can guess what Video Game this villain is in I'll give you 3 free thumbs up! To make it a bit hard I won't say when this game was released but will say it's only on the PS2.
 
 The name of my new favorite villain is Xemnas! Let the guessing begin!
 
 (Just kinda bored :) )

SEPHIROTH!!!!!
 SEPHIROTH IS GOD!!!

Kefka would just poison Sephiroth and the rest of SOLDIER and take control of the rest of the puny civilization using his goddess statues.:p

Well, I think Darth Vader is the best villain ever. He epitomizes evil (until the end). 
 
 The Gruber brothers from Die Hard were great. 
 
 The Joker by Jack Nicholson was really good.
 
 Dr. Robotnik (I was a huge Sonic/SEGA fan)
 
 By the way Matthew, Magneto was not fighting for justice and equality. If you remember the plot of X-2, he wanted to kill all the humans. Hardly sounds like either but if we are mirroring villains to personalities then I guess I could be Hannibal Lectre because I like a wide variety of foods. 
 Disclaimer (for our overly PC society): No, I'm not a cannibal, it was a joke.
Dr Strangelove is my best. Forever
